title: Understanding SQL Wildcards
text: In SQL, the LIKE operator is used in a WHERE clause to search for a specified pattern in a column. Wildcards are used to substitute one or more characters in a string.

title: Using the Percent Sign (%)
text: The percent sign (%) is a wildcard character in SQL that represents zero, one, or multiple characters. It is used to define patterns in a LIKE clause like '%this' which would return strings that end in this.

title: Formulating the WHERE Clause
text: How would you write a WHERE clause to find all records where the Note column starts with 'urgent'?
